p: Similar to the current findings, Zhao et al. [ 11] and Purschke et al. [ 19] found protein content to 82% for yellow mealworm and migratory locust. Alternatively, research investigating other insect species found slightly lower values ranging from 65–75% for insoluble, 58–69% for soluble, and 50–61% for supernatant fractions [ 12, 16]. Chitin and chitin-bound protein that is consequently indigestible, are likely to contribute to the protein content found in ILF [ 10]. Although not the focus of the current study, this can lead to lower digestibility compared to supernatant and pellet (soluble) fractions, as documented by Yi et al. [ 13].
